• @lincolnthree

The problem with IDEs

  • Great for editing, terrible for automating.
  • Not so great for extending and sharing.

Our Objectives

  1. Learn - Why Forge?
  2. Use - Crowdsource an application
  3. Extend - Quickly build and share tools
  4. Reuse - Embed the Future<?>

Why Forge?

  • We believe that programming should be pragmatic, productive, and fun ...
  • ... and by creating a tool that encourages creative and collaborative solutions that are easily shared ...
  • ... we can build a community-driven ecosystem that makes us all more effective.

Forge:

  • Aids in automation of common development tasks
  • Performs setup of boilerplate code and configuration.
  • Helps you focus on business-centric activities.
  • Write tools once, run in any IDE, and share them.

Is not an editor.

Crowdsource an Application

How does it work?

Quickly build and share tools

Embed the Future<?>
